summary.para: Enables an app to register a callback function through which it can be notified that its library is going into or coming out of a suspended state. The app can use this information to perform any necessary operations, such as preserving state, that should be performed at that point.

param.name: Routine
param.para: A pointer to a callback function that is called when the app enters or leaves the suspended state. See PAPPSTATE_CHANGE_ROUTINE for more detail on this function.

param.name: Context
param.para: App-specific context information that the app uses when going into or out of a suspended state. This is commonly a "this" pointer.

param.name: Registration
param.para: When this function returns successfully, this parameter receives the address of a pointer to a value that can be used to identify the registration. Store this value to use with .

summary.para: Cancels a change notification registered through .

param.name: Registration
param.para: A pointer to the registration handle retrieved by through its Registration parameter.

returns.para: This function does not return a value.
